sen.j: 吉備内親王（きびないしんのう、生年不詳 - 神亀6年2月12日 (旧暦)（729年3月20日））は、草壁皇子と元明天皇の次女。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Kibi, year of birth unknown, died on 20 March 729, is the second daughter of Prince Kusakabe and Empress Genmei.
Imperial Princess Kibi (year of birth unknown - March 20, 729) is the second daughter of Prince Kusakabe and Empress Genmei.
sen.cmt: 日付がスタイル違反です。原文に合わせて、括弧を使用しました。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Kibi (year of birth unknown - March 20, 729) is the second daughter of Prince Kusakabe and Empress Genmei.

sen.j: 元正天皇、文武天皇の姉妹。
sen.e: A sister of Empress Gensho and Emperor Monmu.
The sister of Empress Gensho and Emperor Monmu.
The sister of Empress Gensho and Emperor Monmu.

sen.j: 長屋王の変で自殺に追い込まれた。
sen.e: She was forced into suicide in Nagayao no Hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao).

sen.j: 吉備内親王は長屋王に嫁ぎ、膳夫王・葛木王・鉤取王を産んだ。
sen.e: She married Prince Nagaya and gave birth to Kashiwade no Okimi, Prince Katsuragi, and Kagitori no Okimi.
She married Prince Nagaya and gave birth to Kashiwade no Okimi, Prince Katsuragi, and Kagitori no Okimi.

sen.j: 和銅8年（715年）2月25日に、息子達が皇孫待遇になる。
sen.e: On 25 February 715 her Musuko (sons) came to be treated as imperial descendants.
On February 25, 715, her sons became imperial descendants.
sen.cmt: 日付がスタイル違反です。カンマが必要です。不要な箇所を一部削除、変更しました。
sen.e: On April 7, 715, her sons became imperial descendants.

sen.j: 同年、元号が霊亀となった後に三品に叙される。
sen.e: In the same year she was ordained Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Princes' rank) after the era name turned to Reiki.
sen.cmt: 霊亀はこの文脈では生物の名前ではなく元号と判断し、定訳を採用しませんでした。
sen.e: In the same year, she was ordained Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Princes' rank) after the era name turned to Reiki.
In the same year, she was ordained Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Princes' rank) after the era name turned to Reiki.

sen.j: 神亀元年（724年）2月4日に二品に叙される。
sen.e: On 4 February 724 she was ordained Nihon (the second court rank for Imperial Princes).
On February 4, 724, she was ordained Nihon (the second court rank for Imperial Princes).
sen.cmt: 日付がスタイル違反です。カンマが必要です。
sen.e: On March 7, 724, she was ordained Nihon (the second court rank for Imperial Princes).

sen.j: しかし、神亀6年（729年）2月、長屋王の使用人であった漆部造君足と中臣宮処連東人の密告により、長屋王が国を傾けるため「左道」を行ったとされた。
sen.e: However in February 729, employees of Prince Nagaya, Nuribeno Miyatsuko Kimitari and Nakatomino Miyakono Muraji Azumabito laid information against him saying that he did "Sato (an evil course)".
sen.cmt: ・中臣宮処連東人 なかとみのみやこ の むらじあずまびと：このかたまりで1つの人名であるため、定訳は採用しませんでした。http://homepage.mac.com/kamekokishi/nagayaou.html・一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, in February 729, employees of Prince Nagaya, Nuribeno Miyatsuko Kimitari and Nakatomino Miyakono Muraji Azumabito laid information against him saying that he did "Sato (an evil course)".
However, in March 729, employees of Prince Nagaya, Nuribeno Miyatsuko Kimitari and Nakatomino Miyakono Muraji Azumabito laid information against him saying that he did "Sato (an evil course)".

sen.j: 彼は自刃に追い込まれた。
sen.e: Prince Nagaya was forced to kill himself.

sen.j: 吉備内親王も、3人の息子達と共に縊死した。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Kibi died by hanging with her three sons.

sen.j: 彼女は長屋王と同じく、生駒山に埋葬された。
sen.e: She was buried on the Mt. Ikoma as was Prince Nagaya.
She was buried on Mt. Ikoma as was Prince Nagaya.

sen.j: 当時皇太子基王が急死し、自らも病弱であった聖武天皇に万が一の事があれば、天皇の叔母にあたる内親王やその子供達の皇位継承の可能性もあったと考えられる。
sen.e: If Prince Motoi, Crown Prince suddenly died and if anything happened to Emperor Shomu who was sickly himself at that time, Imperial Princess who was aunt of Emperor and her sons are thought to have had possibility to succeed the Imperial Throne.

If Prince Motoi, the Crown Prince suddenly died and if anything happened to Emperor Shomu who was sick himself at that time, the Imperial Princess who was the aunt of the Emperor and her sons were thought to have had the possibility of succeeding the Imperial Throne.
sen.cmt: 定冠詞が必要です。時制、文法等が一部間違っていたため、変更しました。
sen.e: If Prince Motoi, the Crown Prince suddenly died and if anything happened to Emperor Shomu who was sick himself at that time, the Imperial Princess who was the aunt of the Emperor and her sons were thought to have had the possibility of succeeding the Imperial Throne.

sen.j: 天皇が根拠のない密告を信じて政府首班の長屋王を死に追い込んだ背景には、皇位を巡る天皇の疑心暗鬼があったとする説もある。
sen.e: Some say in the context of Emperor's believing in information without solid foundation to force Prince Nagaya, the leader of government, to commit suicide was Emperor's doubts and fears about the throne.
